Server Module¶

server.py

This module implements the server-side logic for a secure UDP chat application. It performs RSA-based AES key exchange, decrypts and verifies incoming messages using HMAC, and rebroadcasts valid messages to all connected clients. Messages are validated for freshness and authenticity.

Author: Burak Yilmaz

server.server.handle_client(stdscr, server_socket, addr, data)¶

Handle an incoming message from a client.

Parameters:

  • stdscr – curses window object.

  • server_socket – The server’s UDP socket.

  • addr – Address tuple of the client.

  • data – The received data (bytes).

server.server.is_recent(timestamp)¶

Check if the timestamp is within the last 5 minutes.

Parameters:

timestamp (str) – Unix timestamp as string.

Returns:

True if timestamp is recent; False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

server.server.start_server(stdscr, host='0.0.0.0', port=9999)¶

Start the secure UDP server.

Parameters:

  • stdscr – curses window object for display.

  • host (str) – Host IP to bind to (default ‘0.0.0.0’ listens on all interfaces).

  • port (int) – Port number to listen on.
